item.title: Historical Materialism
item.description: “Men make their own history, but they do not make it as they please; they do not make it under self-selected circumstances, but under circumstances existing already, given and transmitted from the past.” (Marx, 1852) It might seem a bit contradictory at first—how can we create our own history when we’re limited by what’s happened before? But I think it really captures the essence of “historical materialism.” This concept, introduced by Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels, focuses on how societies develop not through random thoughts or actions of a few people, but through the real challenges and situations that everyone faces.
